unnormalised: The year was 2010. Rajan, fresh out of college and starting his first job at TCS, knew he needed to be responsible. His father, a retired school teacher, had always stressed the importance of planning for the future. Rajan remembered him saying, "Beta, a good insurance policy is like a safety net. You never know when you might need it." So, Rajan started looking into different options. He saw ads for policies promising returns of 12% p.a. and others that talked about tax benefits under Section 80C. It was all quite confusing.
normalised: The year was two thousand and ten. Rajan, fresh out of college and starting his first job at T-C-S, knew he needed to be responsible. His father, a retired school teacher, had always stressed the importance of planning for the future. Rajan remembered him saying, "Beta, a good insurance policy is like a safety net. You never know when you might need it." So, Rajan started looking into different options. He saw ads for policies promising returns of twelve percent p.a. and others that talked about tax benefits under Section eighty C. It was all quite confusing.

unnormalised: He initially considered a ULIP, seeing the potential for high returns. The agent promised him that investing just Rs. 5000 per month would secure his future. However, a colleague, Priya, who had been working for a few years, cautioned him. “Rajan, ULIPs can be tricky. Look at the charges and ensure you understand the market risks,” she advised. Priya suggested he explore term insurance coupled with a separate investment plan. "Consider a term life cover of Rs. 1 crore. It's surprisingly affordable," she said.
normalised: He initially considered a U-L-I-P, seeing the potential for high returns. The agent promised him that investing just rupee five thousand per month would secure his future. However, a colleague, Priya, who had been working for a few years, cautioned him. “Rajan, U-L-I-Ps can be tricky. Look at the charges and ensure you understand the market risks,” she advised. Priya suggested he explore term insurance coupled with a separate investment plan. "Consider a term life cover of rupee one crore. It's surprisingly affordable," she said.

unnormalised: Following Priya's advice, Rajan opted for a term insurance plan from HDFC Life for a sum assured of Rs. 1,00,00,000. The premium came to approx. Rs. 8000 annually. He also started a systematic investment plan (SIP) in a mutual fund, investing Rs. 4000 per month. He felt a sense of security knowing that his family would be financially protected in case anything happened to him. Years later, he also took a health insurance policy covering his parents with a sum insured of Rs. 5 lakh each.
normalised: Following Priya's advice, Rajan opted for a term insurance plan from H-D-F-C Life for a sum assured of rupee one crore. The premium came to approximately rupee eight thousand annually. He also started a systematic investment plan (S-I-P) in a mutual fund, investing rupee four thousand per month. He felt a sense of security knowing that his family would be financially protected in case anything happened to him. Years later, he also took a health insurance policy covering his parents with a sum insured of rupee five lakh each.

unnormalised: Fast forward to 2023. Rajan, now a seasoned professional, realized the wisdom in his early decisions. He saw several colleagues struggle during unexpected medical emergencies and some families facing financial hardship after the unfortunate demise of a loved one. His insurance policies had provided him and his family with peace of mind. The term insurance gave him coverage till age 65.
normalised: Fast forward to two thousand and twenty three. Rajan, now a seasoned professional, realized the wisdom in his early decisions. He saw several colleagues struggle during unexpected medical emergencies and some families facing financial hardship after the unfortunate demise of a loved one. His insurance policies had provided him and his family with peace of mind. The term insurance gave him coverage till age sixty five.

unnormalised: Rajan often shares his experience with younger colleagues. He tells them, "Don't wait. Start early. Even a small policy can make a big difference." He emphasizes the importance of understanding the policy terms and comparing different options before making a decision. He often says, “Just like you budget for chai and samosas every month, budget for insurance. It's an investment in your peace of mind." And he usually ends with, "Check out Policybazaar.com or similar sites to compare policies easily."
